org.nikko.humanize

Class Humanize

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nikko.humanize.Humanize

  • public final class Humanize
extends Object

    Facility for adding a "human touch" to data. It is thread-safe and supports per-thread internationalization. Additionally provides a concise facade to access i18n text formatters.

    Author:
    mfornos

    • Method Detail

      • binaryPrefix

        public static String binaryPrefix(Number value)

        Converts a given number to a string preceded by the corresponding binary International System of Units (SI) prefix.

        Input Output
        2 "2 bytes"
        1536 "1.5 kB"
        5242880 "5.00 MB"
        1325899906842624L "1.18 PB"
        Parameters:
        value - Number to be converted
        Returns:
        The number preceded by the corresponding binary SI prefix

      • formatCurrency

        public static String formatCurrency(Number value)

        Smartly formats the given number as a monetary amount.

        For en_GB:

        Input Output
        34 "£34"
        1000 "£1,000"
        12.5 "£12.50"

        Parameters:
        value - Number to be formatted
        Returns:
        String representing the monetary amount

        locale - Target locale
        Returns:
        String representing the monetary amount

      • naturalDay

        public static String naturalDay(Date value)

        Same as naturalDay with DateFormat.SHORT style.

        Parameters:
        value - Date to be converted
        Returns:
        String with "today", "tomorrow" or "yesterday" compared to current day. Otherwise, returns a string formatted according to a locale sensitive DateFormat.

      • naturalDay

        public static String naturalDay(int style,
                Date value)

        For dates that are the current day or within one day, return "today", "tomorrow" or "yesterday", as appropriate. Otherwise, returns a string formatted according to a locale sensitive DateFormat.

        Parameters:
        style - DateFormat style
        value - Date to be converted
        Returns:
        String with "today", "tomorrow" or "yesterday" compared to current day. Otherwise, returns a string formatted according to a locale sensitive DateFormat.

      • naturalTime

        public static String naturalTime(Date duration)

        Same as naturalTime with current date as reference.

        Parameters:
        duration - Date to be used as duration from current date
        Returns:
        String representing the relative date

      • naturalTime

        public static String naturalTime(Date reference,
                 Date duration)

        Computes both past and future relative dates.

        E.g. "one day ago", "one day from now", "10 years ago", "3 minutes from now", "right now" and so on.

        Parameters:
        reference - Date to be used as reference
        duration - Date to be used as duration from reference
        Returns:
        String representing the relative date

      • naturalTime

                 Date duration,

        Same as naturalTime for the specified locale.

        Parameters:

        duration - Date to be used as duration from reference
        locale - Target locale
        Returns:

      • ordinalize

        public static String ordinalize(Number value)

        Converts a number to its ordinal as a string.

        Input Output
        1 "1st"
        2 "2nd"
        3 "3rd"
        4 "4th"
        1002 "1002nd"
        2012 "2012th"
        Parameters:
        value - Number to be converted
        Returns:
        String representing the number as ordinal

        Parameters:

        locale - Target locale
        Returns:

      • pluralize

        public static Message pluralize(String template)

        Constructs a message with pluralization logic from the given template.

        Example: 
         
 Message msg = pluralize("There {0} on {1}.::are no files::is one file::are {2} files");
 
 msg.render(0, "disk");    // == "There are no files on disk."
 msg.render(1, "disk");    // == "There is one file on disk."
 msg.render(1000, "disk"); // == "There are 1,000 files on disk."
        Parameters:
        template - String of tokens delimited by '::'
        Returns:
        Message instance prepared to generate pluralized strings

      • pluralize

        public static Message pluralize(String template,
                Locale locale)

        Same as pluralize for the specified locale.

        Parameters:
        template - String of tokens delimited by '::'
        locale - Target locale
        Returns:
        Message instance prepared to generate pluralized strings

      • pluralize

        public static Message pluralize(String pattern,
                String... choices)

        Constructs a message with pluralization logic by the means of ChoiceFormat.

        Parameters:
        pattern - Base pattern
        choices - Values that match the pattern
        Returns:
        Message instance prepared to generate pluralized strings

      • spellBigNumber

        public static String spellBigNumber(Number value)

        Converts a big number to a friendly text representation. Accepts values ranging from thousands to googols. Uses BigDecimal.

        Parameters:
        value - Number to be converted
        Returns:
        Friendly text representation of the given value

      • spellDigit

        public static String spellDigit(Number value)

        For decimal digits [0-9], returns the number spelled out. Otherwise, returns the number as string.

        Input Output
        1 "one"
        2 "two"
        10 "10"
        Parameters:
        value - Decimal digit
        Returns:
        String representing the number spelled out

      • spellDigit

        public static String spellDigit(Number value,
                Locale locale)

        Same as spellDigit for the specified locale.

        Parameters:
        value - Decimal digit
        locale - Target locale
        Returns:
        String representing the number spelled out

      • titleize

        public static String titleize(String text)

        Capitalize all the words, and replace some characters in the string to create a nice looking title.

        Input Output
        "the_jackie_gleason show" "The Jackie Gleason Show"
        "first annual report (CD) 2001" "First Annual Report (CD) 2001"
        Parameters:
        text - Text to be converted
        Returns:
        Nice looking title

      • uncamelize

        public static String uncamelize(String words)

        Converts a camel case string into a human-readable name.

        Input Output
        "MyClass" "My Class"
        "GL11Version" "GL 11 Version"
        "AString" "A String"
        "SimpleXMLParser" "Simple XML Parser"
        Parameters:
        words - String to be converted
        Returns:
        words converted to human-readable name

      • wordWrap

        public static String wordWrap(String value,
              int len)

        Truncate a string to the closest word boundary after a number of characters.

        Parameters:
        value - Text to be truncated
        len - Number of characters
        Returns:
        String truncated to the closes word boundary
